title: Technical Program Manager II, Chrome OS Platform
description: A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. Join the team that's been powering Chrome OS devices for over a decade!
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience in program management. 1 year of experience in consumer hardware engineering.
preferred_qualifications: 5 years of experience in consumer electronics and product development. 2 years of experience managing cross-functional or cross-team projects. Experience with ChromeOS and hardware bringup. Knowledge of SoC Architecture.
responsibilities: Own the entire life-cycle from initial concept to final OEM product launch, driving both hardware and software development. Collaborate with product managers to shape the Chrome OS roadmap, allocate resources, create detailed project plans, and track progress. Partner with internal engineering teams, external partners, and OEM/ODMs to deliver high-quality devices on time. Work with cross-functional teams to test devices, manage bug triage, and support ongoing Chrome OS updates. Develop efficient tools and processes to enhance engineering productivity and streamline device bringup.
